## `fdasrvf`
I'm lead author of the `fdasrvf` R package ([CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/fdasrvf/index.html); [GitHub](https://github.com/jdtuck/fdasrvf_R)). 

This pacakge performs alignment, PCA, and modeling of multidimensional and unidimensional functions using the square-root velocity framework (Srivastava et al., 2011 [arXiv:1103.3817](https://arxiv.org/abs/1103.3817) and Tucker et al., 2014 [doi:10.1016/j.csda.2012.12.001](Papers/CSDA_PCA_12.pdf)). This framework allows for elastic analysis of functional data through phase and amplitude separation. Multiple papers utilize the work in this package and is listed in the [CRAN Functional Data Analysis Task View](https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/FunctionalData.html)

There are also version of this code for [MATLAB](https://github.com/jdtuck/fdasrvf_MATLAB), [Python](https://github.com/jdtuck/fdasrsf_python), and [Julia](https://github.com/jdtuck/ElasticFDA.jl)

Documentation for the Python (Documentation: [HTML](fdasrsf/html/index.html) or [PDF](fdasrsf/fdasrsf.pdf))
Documentation for the Julia (Documentation: [HTML](http://elasticfdajl.readthedocs.org/en/latest/))
